title: Love Island host Sophie Monk sizzles as she flaunts her curves in a skimpy white bikini in Fiji
text:
Love Island Australia may cast a host of good-looking people to parade around in their swimsuits while looking for love.

But on Wednesday, host Sophie Monk proved she could equally sizzle in a bikini away from the dating show's set.

Taking to Instagram, the blonde bombshell flaunted her slender figure in a skimpy white bikini during a day off from filming with boyfriend Josh Gross.

White on the mark! Love Island Australia host Sophie Monk sizzles in a skimpy bikini as she enjoys a day off filming reality show in Fiji

Sophie shared a series of snaps, in which it appeared she just emerged from Fiji's crystalline waters.

Good-natured TV star Sophie appeared to get her boyfriend Joshua to take the racy beachside snaps.

'You know you've got a good bf when you're not water proof with fake tan and hair extensions but he still takes good pics regardless,' she wrote.

Wet look! Sophie (pictured) shot the camera a sultry look as she posed on the beach

Sophie geo-tagged herself at the luxurious Shangri-La in Fiji.

The snaps come after Sophie confirmed she will have a bigger role on Love Island Australia this year, during an interview with OK! magazine.

'[I will be on there] maybe a little more because there are a heap of new twists and turns on this season,' she said.

Oh, my! Sophie (pictured) struggled to contain her assets in the skimpy white bikini top

While her role is more wide-ranging than last year, Love Island Australia will remain focused on the sexy contestants and their 'recoupling' ceremonies.

'The show is all about the boys and girls,' she said. 'I'm the host and I think people are more aware of how Love Island works [now] and what my role is.'

During season one, Sophie left viewers scratching their heads when she only appeared a handful of times.

Some fans even questioned whether Channel Nine executives had spent their money wisely after Sophie signed a rumoured $1million deal with the network.

Bigger role: Sophie (pictured) revealed she would have a bigger role on Love Island this year

In March, former Bardot singer Sophie told HIT 105's Stav, Abby and Matt that she's hoping for a ring.

'I said we're going to get married, but he hasn't proposed so I probably should have thought that through and given him a choice in the situation,' she said laughing.

The couple first met on a flight from Europe to Australia last August, and shared a kiss after enjoying 'three champagnes' in business class.

Love Island Australia continues on Channel Nine, Thursday, 8.30pm.
